thread.title: Former EastEnders star Jo Joyner joins upcoming Channel 4 school drama The ABC
thread.title_full: Former EastEnders star Jo Joyner joins upcoming Channel 4 school drama The ABC

title: Former EastEnders star Jo Joyner joins upcoming Channel 4 school drama The ABC
text:
MY TIME TO JO Former EastEnders star Jo Joyner joins upcoming Channel 4 school drama The ABC 
The soap actress, who played beautician Tanya Branning for seven years before quitting in 2013, will star as a strict headteacher Exclusive From Dan Wootton's Bizarre Column 22nd February 2017, 6:00 pm Comments TANYA Branning was a Walford favourite during her seven years in EastEnders. 
But actress JO JOYNER is transforming from Albert Square’s resident beautician to a strict headteacher for her next role. 
She has jumped ship to Channel 4 for a brand new school drama, The ABC, which she started filming this week. BBC 3 Jo Joyner as Tanya in EastEnders 
But Jo, who plays Mandy Carter at Yorkshire’s Ackley Bridge College in the six-part series, isn’t the only soap star to have signed up. 
Fellow former EastEnder PAUL NICHOLLS will play her long-suffering PE teacher husband while ex-Casualty actress SUNETRA SARKER is dinner lady Kaneez Paracha, who is also a single mum to new students Nasreen, Razia and Saleem. 
Joining them in the British cast is Four Lions’ ARSHER ALI , Liz White from Life on Mars and Citizen Khan’s ADIL RAY . BBC Jo Joyner played the role for seven years related stories 'I JUST WANTED TO GROW UP' Vicky Pattison finally reveals the REAL reason why she quit Geordie Shore ZIGGY STARSTRUCK Craig David reveals David Bowie was a secret fan of his BEST DRESSED Michelle Keegan leads the BRIT Awards 2017 red carpet glamour in a figure-hugging blue jumpsuit Baby steps Geri Horner flashes a smile and looks effortlessly glamorous as she takes new baby Monty on a walk Having a ball Dennis Taylor to appear on The Real Marigold Hotel 17 years after his snooker retirement Barrie Abroad All you need to know about Amanda Barrie as she enters The Real Marigold Hotel A NEW SUPERSTAR Who is Paul Nicholas? The Real Marigold Hotel resident, West End star and singer - all you need to know paying tribute Brit Awards will honour George Michael tonight as late icon's sisters Yioda and Melanie look on Baring almost all Little Mix star Jade Thirlwall flashes her knickers at The BRIT Awards 2017 as her dress comes undone THE GOULDING GIRLS Ellie Goulding shares the spotlight at the BRIT Awards 2017 with her rarely-seen sister Jordan winner takes all Planning on watching the BRITs tonight? Here's all you need to know... GIRL POWER! Lizzie Cundy channels her inner Spice Girl with THAT Union Jack dress for the BRIT Awards Former EastEnders star Shaun Williamson defends Danny Dyer 
The weekly 8pm hour-long show will air later this year and promises plenty of drama. BBC 3 She became a household face due to her role in Eastenders 
The college is formed from two merging schools which causes plenty of problems for headmistress Mandy who has to deal with explosive fall-outs and problem pupils. 
But the programme is in good hands, being produced by Alexander Lamb, who previously worked on another long-running school drama, Waterloo Road. 
If it has half the success of that, it’ll be a huge hit.
